definition: to shout an order or command
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Cascarellian considered this for a moment. Then he called the convoy to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 老卡斯卡利安想了一会，然后喝令护卫队停车。

sentences.english: The soldier challenged the stranger as soon as she appeared.
sentences.chinese: 陌生人一出现，士兵便喝令她站住，加以盘问。

sentences.english: He ignored the sentry's challenge to halt.
sentences.chinese: 他不理睬哨兵喝令止步的盘问。

sentences.english: Let the sea rise into Xi for his revenge.
sentences.chinese: 升海喝令成曦找成勋报仇。

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to shout at sb to stop
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to promise/to agree to do sth
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
